{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Accountant",
  "description": "Garki Hospital Abuja is an indigenous Organisation providing health care services within the Abuja metropolis and environs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements
Educational Qualification:


	B.Sc./HND in Accounting or any other related discipline from any recognized University/Polytechnic.


Professional Qualification:


	Must be a Chartered Member of Institute of Chartered Accountants of Nigeria (ACA) or Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA).


Experience:


	He / She must have a minimum of 3 years post-qualification or 10 years post-graduation cognate experience in revenue accounting, receivables management or financial reporting.


Skills:


	Experience in ERP/accounting software usage
	Strong knowledge of revenue Accounting function
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (advanced level)
	Knowledge of internal control systems
	Analytical and reporting skills
	Candidates for the above position must be good team players and must possess good interpersonal skills.


Benefits
Salary is attractive and negotiable.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, application Letter, daytime telephone numbers &amp; copies of credentials to:&nbsp;careers@garkihospital.com&nbsp;or&nbsp;cd@garkihospital.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note:&nbsp;Only emailed applications will be entertained.",

Accountant Job at Garki Hospital Abuja




        
    

        
        Garki Hospital Abuja is an indigenous Organisation providing health care services within the Abuja metropolis and environs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements
Educational Qualification:


	B.Sc./HND in Accounting or any other related discipline from any recognized University/Polytechnic.


Professional Qualification:
     

            
    




	Must be a Chartered Member of Institute of Chartered Accountants of Nigeria (ACA) or Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA).


Experience:


	He / She must have a minimum of 3 years post-qualification or 10 years post-graduation cognate experience in revenue accounting, receivables management or financial reporting.


Skills:


	Experience in ERP/accounting software usage
	Strong knowledge of revenue Accounting function
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (advanced level)
	Knowledge of internal control systems
	Analytical and reporting skills
	Candidates for the above position must be good team players and must possess good interpersonal skills.


Benefits
Salary is attractive and negotiable.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, application Letter, daytime telephone numbers & copies of credentials to: [email protected] or [email protected] using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only emailed applications will be entertained.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Digital Executive Assistant",
  "description": "Divine O3 Service Limited is a professional consulting and human resource solutions company dedicated to supporting organizations in building efficient, compliant, and high-performing workforces. We provide strategic consulting, recruitment, and end-to-end HR services designed to help businesses optimize their people, processes, and performance. Our consulting services focus on organizational development, HR strategy, workforce planning, and business process improvement.

We work closely with clients to understand their operational needs and deliver practical, results-driven solutions that enhance productivity, strengthen leadership, and support sustainable growth. Through our recruitment and talent acquisition services, we identify, attract, and place qualified professionals who align with our clients&rsquo; values, culture, and business objectives. Our structured recruitment process ensures the delivery of competent, reliable, and well-screened candidates across various roles and industries.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Digital Executive Assistant
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	We are seeking a tech-savvy, highly organized, and proactive Digital Executive Assistant to support the leadership in our company.
	You will be responsible for managing digital workflows, coordinating community engagement on Telegram, and supporting the expansion of our digital trading and partnership operations.
	The ideal candidate is a &quot;digital native&quot; who understands online business systems and can communicate professionally with a diverse team.


Key Responsibilities


	?Digital Operations: Manage and optimize daily digital systems, ensuring smooth communication and effective work environment
	Administrative Support: Manage executive calendars, organize virtual meetings, and handle digital documentation for the organization.
	Reporting: Track team performance and affiliate income metrics, providing weekly reports on growth and engagement.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications with years of work experience.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 / month

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified&nbsp;candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;divine03serviceslimited@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Digital Executive Assistant Job at Divine O3 Service Limited




        
    

        
        Divine O3 Service Limited is a professional consulting and human resource solutions company dedicated to supporting organizations in building efficient, compliant, and high-performing workforces. We provide strategic consulting, recruitment, and end-to-end HR services designed to help businesses optimize their people, processes, and performance. Our consulting services focus on organizational development, HR strategy, workforce planning, and business process improvement.
     

            
    



We work closely with clients to understand their operational needs and deliver practical, results-driven solutions that enhance productivity, strengthen leadership, and support sustainable growth. Through our recruitment and talent acquisition services, we identify, attract, and place qualified professionals who align with our clients’ values, culture, and business objectives. Our structured recruitment process ensures the delivery of competent, reliable, and well-screened candidates across various roles and industries.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Digital Executive Assistant
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	We are seeking a tech-savvy, highly organized, and proactive Digital Executive Assistant to support the leadership in our company.
	You will be responsible for managing digital workflows, coordinating community engagement on Telegram, and supporting the expansion of our digital trading and partnership operations.
	The ideal candidate is a "digital native" who understands online business systems and can communicate professionally with a diverse team.


Key Responsibilities


	?Digital Operations: Manage and optimize daily digital systems, ensuring smooth communication and effective work environment
	Administrative Support: Manage executive calendars, organize virtual meetings, and handle digital documentation for the organization.
	Reporting: Track team performance and affiliate income metrics, providing weekly reports on growth and engagement.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications with years of work experience.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 / month

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: [email protected] using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Senior Mobile iOS Engineer (Last Mile Delivery)",
  "description": "Yassir is the leading super App in the Maghreb region set to changing the way daily services are provided. It currently operates in 45 cities across Algeria, Morocco and Tunisia with recent expansions into France, Canada and Sub-Saharan Africa. It is backed (~$200M in funding) by VCs from Silicon Valley, Europe and other parts of the world.

We offer on-demand services such as ride-hailing and last-mile delivery. Building on this infrastructure, we are now introducing financial services to help our users pay, save and borrow digitally. Job Position: Senior Mobile iOS Engineer (Last Mile Delivery)

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos, Nigeria
Job type: Full-time (Hybrid)
Category:&nbsp;Product &amp; Tech &ndash; Last Mile Delivery

About the Role


	In this role, you will be part of our engineering team, working with a high quality code base and the latest tools, where you will promote your skills to be an expert in complex frontend development in iOS (swift and swiftUI) native platforms.
	Your primary focus will be development of mobile applications and their integration with back-end services.
	You will be working alongside other engineers and developers working on different layers of the infrastructure.

Senior Mobile iOS Engineer (Last Mile Delivery) Job at Yassir




        
    

        
        Yassir is the leading super App in the Maghreb region set to changing the way daily services are provided. It currently operates in 45 cities across Algeria, Morocco and Tunisia with recent expansions into France, Canada and Sub-Saharan Africa. It is backed (~$200M in funding) by VCs from Silicon Valley, Europe and other parts of the world.

We offer on-demand services such as ride-hailing and last-mile delivery. Building on this infrastructure, we are now introducing financial services to help our users pay, save and borrow digitally. Helping usher the continent into a digital economy era. We’re not just about serving people - we’re about creating a marketplace to bring people what they need while infusing social values.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Mobile iOS Engineer (Last Mile Delivery)

Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
Job type: Full-time (Hybrid)
Category: Product & Tech – Last Mile Delivery

About the Role


	In this role, you will be part of our engineering team, working with a high quality code base and the latest tools, where you will promote your skills to be an expert in complex frontend development in iOS (swift and swiftUI) native platforms.
	Your primary focus will be development of mobile applications and their integration with back-end services.
	You will be working alongside other engineers and developers working on different layers of the infrastructure.
	Therefore, a commitment to a highly dynamic environment, where root cause analysis and rapid collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and the creation of quality products are required.


Tasks


	Design and build mobile applications for iOS.
	Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications
	Collaborate with a team to define, design, and ship new features
	Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs
	Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization
	Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute ideas to our technology, algorithms and products.
	Work with the engineering and design teams to understand end-user requirements, formulate use cases, and then translate that into a pragmatic and effective technical solution
	Dive into difficult problems and successfully deliver results on schedule


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a B.Sc / M.Sc in Engineering, Computer Science or relevant field
	Must have technical skills with at least 5 years of experience
	Language: iOS (swift) native
	Familiarity with cloud message APIs and push notification
	Web architecture: Rest and restful APIs, micro-services
	Version control: GIT
	Nice to have technical skills (Strongly advised)
	Containers: Docker, kubernetes
	Caching, Redis server
	Scaling, Web load balancing
	Experience in a rapidly growing company in the mobility, on-demand or fintech space is a plus


Benefits


	Ground floor opportunity with the team; shape the strategic direction of the company
	Sharp, motivated co-workers in a fun office environment or in remote


Why you should join YASSIR


	Join one of the fastest-growing tech companies in North Africa
	Have a lasting impact on our company's culture
	Make a real impact on the world by helping us bring affordable financial and on-demand services to millions of Africans
	Work on some really hard technical challenges from identity infrastructure for Africans, digital payment networks to complex mapping and routing systems across the continent.
	We are the first Algerian startup to go through Y Combinator program and we’re backed by top investors including Unpopular Ventures, Rebel Fund and DainTree.VC
